intro: Aizoon canariense, commonly known as the Canary Island rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems. The plant produces small, brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of yellow or red, which bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid and coastal conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
